content.detailedDescription: I was out on my cornfields smoking the good stuff and watering my 100 acre property by hand when a orangey green ship docked on my water tank. i ran inside to get the camera and my sawn off shotty when i heard the song "girls just wanna have fun". i turned around to find my cornfield burnt by a sudden fire. my tractor was then abducted by the aliens and now i'm having trouble making an insurance claim. the alien came out of the ship and approached me. i fired a warning shot in the air and yelled "get out, you'll get outa ere you crazy criters" and it ran away screaming. it opened the door of the craft to reveal three female aliens pimpen it out with a male. one of them looked kylie mnouyge. they were all listening do locamotion.
content.summary: Alien sighting

content.detailedDescription: It is 9-28-06, i got off of work at 9:10 p.M. i had a normal drive home on the highway, the sky was dark and the moon was visable as well as the  stars, it was a clear night sky. around 9:35 i arrived in my sub-division. i noticed an unusually bright light in the southern sky. the light seemed to move at a fair speed, the object seemed to be heading in a eastern direction from my strait ahead point of view, the light remained the same brightness as it traveled in that direction, so i ruled out the possibility that it was the headlights of an standard airplane, seeing as how it wouldn't be facing me anymore if it was heading east so there for the light should have diminished if it was a directed airplane headlamp. so i pulled over infront of a neighbors house and took out my cell phone camera and snapped a couple pictures. you can see the difference in the position of the object from the first picture in relation to the second, within the span of about 5 seconds. i'm posting this on mufon to share my experience, and to see if anyone else may have seen this same object, i can't say 100% i know what it was, but it seemed different.
content.summary: I was driving home from work, when i pulled in my neighborhood i noticed a bright circular object in the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
This report is part of an investigation initiated by myself, alex mistretta, based upon reports of repeated ufo activity in st remy, france, and a potential film of a ufo event. 

as such, see below where in investigation slot.
content.summary: Unusual extremely bright lights seen in sky by investigator, while following up on potential ufo reports

content.detailedDescription:
Date and time of encounter:
sydney olympics 2000, homebush site

weather conditions:
clear, mild, scattered cloud, light breeze

duration of the encounter:
two minutes approx.

exact location of the encounter.
zoom in on the car park at:
http://maps.Google.Com/?Ie=utf8&ll=-33.850383,151.071072&spn=0.003217,0.004989&t=h&om=1

number of other witnesses
none known.

shape of unknown objects
slim, silvered horizontal torus x2, connected with three vertical upright shafts.

number of objects sighted
one

colours associated with the objects
silvered, with small dark markings/slots

is there any physical trace evidence?
photograph, taken belatedly at end of encounter, thought to reveal
nothing special, location of it and negative unknown.

did the object land or interact with anything or anyone?
not to my knowledge.

were there any conventional aircrafts near the encounter?
none seen in immediate vicinity (although helicopters were presumably patrolling, given the context.)

did you notice any other activities i.E. military during/after the
encounter?
none noted. (immediate assumption that object was a stray inflatable apparently scotched after movement contrary to wind direction was noted. object seems not to match any uav i've researched.)

any associated noises, smells or electronic disturbances
no sound. specifically no oscillations consistent with fans/props.

encounter location: 
zoom in on the car park at:
http://maps.Google.Com/?Ie=utf8&ll=-33.850383,151.071072&spn=0.003217,0.004989&t=h&om=1


your own description of the encounter:
mid-afternoon, on a weekday (date/time recorded somewhere, but not available at this time, regrettably) i was about to put an object into the boot of my car, when i saw an object reflected in the paintwork of the car's boot as i opened it. immediate impression of circular, or hooped object, and lack of sound. i looked directly up (we city-dwellers never look up, i'm convinced), and saw right above me - at a height of about five meters above the car park asphalt ��� an object that appeared to take up the space of a large garbage can (i.E. approx. 1.2m high by 700mm wide/deep) moving in a south-westerly direction. 

i saw no other people in the carpark, or nearby: there were probably less than 20 cars parked in an area intended for perhaps 60 or more. the area to the south has some greenery and borders a rail cutting that is almost below ground, while south of that is a road and a (typically deserted) pay-to-use carpark. the nearest building (adjacent north of the google maps link) may have been between occupants at the time, also. and since i'm fairly certain that a distant viewer would almost certainly assume that the object was some kind of balloon, i'm not sure that i would expect anyone inside that building to have made much of a fuss. if anything, my fairly placid examination of the thing would probably have been more entertaining. ("hey, mike, come look at this jerk, frozen solid, staring into the sky...")

i initially assumed that it was an inflatable object, probably carrying a camera for the purposes of anti-terrorist surveillance during the olympic games, which were in session. as the object moved slowly away from me, i was able to better see its structure. imagine taking a cylinder (use the dimensions above) and fixing a silvered hoop to the top and bottom edges of the cylinder, and joining them by three equidistant silvered upright shafts (all silvered items [hoops/uprights] being some 10-15cm in diameter), and then removing the central cylinder. (you should have  an object that resembles a very well-constructed, rigid-looking pool toy, dumb as that might sound.) i assumed that the central, empty
cylindrical area within the object probably enclosed a transparent cell containing helium or some other lighter-than-air gas, until i noticed no specular reflections that would be produced by the plastic skin of such a central, lifting cell. the more i watched, the more i became convinced that there was no central, sealed cell of this kind. and since the silvered hoops and upright shafts of the object seemed too slim to contain the volume of gas that would presumably be needed to provide sufficient lift for this object (even assuming extremely light materials for the silvered structure) i became more uneasy. 

as i watched, and as the object continued to move at a steady (human walking) pace away from me, i began to wonder if it might be being kept aloft by some ground-based system, perhaps involving electromagnetics (and some triangulation of ground-based emitters, to prevent canting?). i also noted that there was no oscillation or brownian-type deviations to the object, as would presumably be the case with an free-floating inflatable: it moved very steadily ('rock steady' actually) which also seemed odd. the object always remained perfectly upright, also, unlike (presumably) an inflatable, which would tumble or at least tilt here and there. i began to wonder if there may have been some kind of vectored props working inside the twin hoop structure (perhaps moving too fast for the eye to see) but since there were no obvious gimbals, or hubs or even axles for this kind of item, it seemed even more unsettling. adding to this impression, i then noticed that the silvered hoops seemed to have small rectangular black slits around the edges (perhaps a 1cm high by 4cm wide) of the twin hoops, which i will unwillingly call windows (which would presume very small occupants, obviously). i also could see no overhead balloon, above the object, which might conceivably be providing the lift to what might be some kind of payload (the object was enclosed and alone, as far as i could see). 

the small 'windows' circled the outside-facing edges of the two torii. (also, this thing was close to the ground, and not some giant, high-flying object: as it moved off, i saw grounded objects - buildings, trees - through/beyond it.) lastly, the upright shafts ended within the torii, and did not stick messily out of them as in my diagram (see below). my diagram is the object seen from my perspective, from below, moving steadily away from me, veering towards the left.

i noted that the object was able to slowly and smoothly rotate - not very much as far as i saw, perhaps 15-degrees or so - back and forth around its vertical axis, as it proceeded away, and did so (a 'scanning' pattern, perhaps?). this is not too interesting, except that it seems inconsistent with (say) some electromagnetic ground-based lift system that would presumably 'lock' onto the vertical shafts as 'attachment points'. to see what i mean, visualise one of those stadium-specific overhead camera robots, that uses three computer-controlled wire-spools attached at three points around the central stadium area, that allows a rigid, non-rotational movement within a three dimensional area (including declination if all three wires are simultaneously unspooled) upon which you mount a 3d gimbal and then a camera. this provides those very good runner-following points of view used in some televised sports.

the object i saw rotated, which would seem to suggest self-motivation and lift, rather than invisible 'attachment' to three ground-based stations, if you follow my reasoning.

for the sake of argument, i imagine that with the cash and the brains it would be possible to create an analogous device to the one i saw, using electromagnetic ground-based systems, but since horizontal movement would presumably be controlled by simultaneous, synchronised 'unspooling' and 'respooling' by the three ground-stations, our analogous device would tend to remain in a specific orientation when seen from above, in spite of movement or declination. one would probably use a thin, ferrous target, and perhaps fill it with some lifting gas if possible, and ideally provide it with some kind of long-life battery and camera to allow long-term aerial surveillance of a demarcated zone. (i wonder though about the bioelectric effects, and whether animals would react to the three converging maglev beams...)

i also recall muttering to myself as it moved away from me: "hm. well... i guess that's a u.F.O. yep... uh huh.. i guess
so..."

my final impression as i watched the object was that i began to wonder if i was seeing the intrusion into three-dimensional (actually 4d, inc. time) space by a multidimensional object. but since i saw no warping, bending, glimmering, illumination, luminescence or other light-affecting characteristics (aside from the basic reflectivity of the silvered, joined hoops) i began to think again that it might simply be some kind of secret, high-tech device that was using transmitted electrical energy to create a lifting effect. 

more recently, i have been wondering about the possibility of a time-shift being involved, such that the device was a probe sent (presumably from the future) by unborn, high-tech, human generations to 'visit' and document a past event, in this case, the well-regarded and uneventful 2000 sydney olympics. (no, i didn't see any logos or writing on the object, and certainly no 'cnn' or such...) 

as the object drifted off, i belatedly remembered that i had a film-loaded compact 35mm camera in the boot of my car, which i (eventually) located and used to take a photo, at which time the object was essentially a light-coloured speck. annoyed i had forgotten about the camera, i went back to watching. the object continued to float, very much against the prevailing wind, beyond a fenced off-area, and since i couldn't see myself trespassing into neighbouring car parks to chase this thing, i put the camera away, signed off on the situation, and went back to work, reasonably convinced it was some new uav, probably being run by some no-doubt amused operator, (perhaps on secondment from the us military in a nearby building or such). 

shortly after the encounter, i described it in detail to a relatively open-minded electrical-engineer, who seemed more certain than i that the object seemed to be breaking various power-weight rules regarding powered inflatables, or metallic objects using some kind of ground-based, targeted, medium-range maglev lifting effect, especially considering its ability to move against the prevailing wind.

finally, i'm only reporting this because i've been looking into current and upcoming uav tech, and this thing doesn't seem to fit into any design (or even operating principle) i've been able to find. (everything out there looks like da vinci machines made by m.I.T., while my ufo looked more like a miniature space station from the 1950's...)

i wonder now if i shouldn't have just leapt onto the boot of my car and tried to grab onto that werner von braun pooltoy, or try to down it with a tyre iron...

my (belated) report's use or significance is not really something i can control (or really want to). if it is recorded and is available to future researchers seeking to establish patterns; that will be fine, and quite enough, for me.
content.summary: Compact silent upright framework device moving at very low altitude across carpark in broad daylight.

content.detailedDescription:
9-27-06 was outside fixing to take my daughter to school, i was admiring the beauty of the blue sky when what looked like chrome object appeared, it was very high in the sky, is was moving towards the rivergate, nashville area.  there were no visible wings, no no contrails, like other planes that morning were putting off, it was very cool outside.  it looked like it was glowing "chrome".  extremely bright, no sound.  i followed it until i lost view of it due to a hill with trees.  when i returned home, aprox. 7:45am  i called my aunt and was telling her about it, and i look up, and there were two more... but one was disc shaped, round, about half the size of the cigar looking one.  the other did not appear as thick as the first one i saw this morning.  the little disk was moving towards rivergate area, the cigar shaped one was moving towards the gallatin area.  the two went right by each other and it appeared the small one moved up a little higher in alltiude,  well i was yelling at her to go look, she was outside at her house, and she started screaming because she too could see the cigar shaped one.  
then last night my children and myself were riding with my father back over to his house, when him and i both saw a huge meteor it was a bright green with white with a medium sized tail that burned out right around drakes creek park, it couldn't have been a telephones length up when it burned out... well that is my newest experience, thought i would share.
also while looking at the pics from yesterday someone from nc had posted, that it excatly what the ones i saw looked like, besides the disk shaped one.
content.summary: 9-27-06 was outside fixing to take my daughter to school, i was admiring the beauty of the blue sky when what looked like chrome object appeared

content.detailedDescription:
I and my other half were driving to tescos last night, and we saw this strange light in the sky to our right, on the horizon as we were going from margate to broadstairs, we saw it moving smoothly and too quickly for it to be a plane. it was a bright orange colour. bearing in mind it was a cloudy night, this was not a star. it seemed to move left a bit, then stopped. we lost it behind some trees, and houses and stuff, but when we actually reached tescos car park, it reappeared. it was right ahead of us as we parked the car. this was about 8.30 last night. it glided right over us. we tried to come up with an explanation that it must be  plane. but when do planes have glowing orange light that doesnt flash?!
anyway it flew over us and disappeared. we then went into tescos to get some cigarettes and stuff, and then we came out and got back in the car and left. we then headed to a country pub near canterbury for a quiet drink, and to the right of us, as we drove out of the manston airport area, this thing reappeared from out of nowhere. i could see it through the right window on my boyfriends side of the car as we drove. 
we both saw it, and this time it just vanished...Out of sight. it was too low down to have vanished behind the clouds, besides it would have kind of faded behind them like planes do, when they fly into the clouds.
this thing just blinked out, like a light being switched off.

we are not convinced that this was a plane.

not only that, but on sunday night, the same sort of thing happened. we were driving on the thanet way heading toward canterbury, and we saw the same kind of orange light, just hovering ahead of us to the right, and moving very strangely. we lost it behind the horizon. then about half hour later we were driving up a country lane, and i noticed this orange glow right above us, above the trees, and as soon as i clapped eyes on it, it just vanished, in the same way as the one last night did. we were both curious as to what it actually was. it really did not look like a plane.
content.summary: Strange object moving too quickly to be a plane, bright orange, not a star, as it was cloudy

content.detailedDescription:
I`was`sitting`on`the`bench`on`the`boardwalk`at`brighton`beach`facing`the`ocean.``it`was`completely`dark.``to`my`right`about`one`quarter`of`the`way`up`from`the`horizon`i`saw`this`so`called`star`on`my`right`making`circles`about`the`size`of`a`quarter.``then`it`started`making`right`angles`which`appeared`about`five`inches`long`from`my`eyesight.``it`would`stop`for`about`ten`minutes`and`continue`for`about`another`ten`minutes`and`off`till`after`daylight.``about`a`halfhour`after`i`first`saw`it`i`saw`one`on`my`left`side.``it`was`mirroring`the`same`movements`at`the`same`time.``this`happened`till`it`was`quite`bright`out.``then`it`just`disappeared.``for`a`short`period`of`time`during`twilight`on`my`right`side`there`was`a`third`very`bright`light`doing`its`own`movements`of`right`turns`and`circles`about`three`inches`away`from`the`other`object.``
i`felt`a`wierd`feeling`that`i`had`to`observe`it.``i`only`told`one`person`because`i`didn`t`think`anyone`would`take`me`seriously.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 2star`like`figures`the`size`of`venus`90`degrees`to`my`right`and`left`making`right`turns`and`circles

content.detailedDescription:
Returning home from errand, turned corner a few blocks from home, object appeared to be going straight down right in front of my vehicle, light went out several degrees above horizon,planes in area on usual trajectory for landing at dulles, object seemed several to many miles past the landing vectors, distance could be from 4-5 to several miles away. very beautiful color. object maintained a steady speed.  no other lights associated with object as with regular faa aircraft.  object left no trail as it went.  in comparison to a thumbnail at arms length it was small, even smaller than the pinky nail. event only lasted 5 seconds or so.  it was wrong color for any meteor-shooting star i have seen ( seen many.) at first thought it might have been a helicopter but the drop was too fast and too steady.  even if a helicopter, no other lights on it after it went out.  the difference in color and the clarity of it in the night sky made it distinctive.  i've never seen anything like it before.

i also saw a ufo cluster about the same place maybe 7-8 years ago.  it was a saturday morning 11 am or thereabouts.  i was in normal traffic on rte. 7 ( leesburg pike) heading east between mirror ridge and sterling bld.  this road goes downhill to a creek and then ascends on the other side. the tree line on the top of each ridge is about the same elevation. straight road. clear skies.  an object was hovering above the horizon tree line and just seemed to be hanging in a drifting breeze.  i thought it was a hot air balloon.  it was an orange color shaded with silver in its center.  as it drifted i noticed that it seemed to be a big ball in the center with satellites around it in a ring.  it was just drifting slowly left to right above the horizon in parallel to the ground. i watched it sitting in traffic waiting for a light change for maybe three or four minutes.  the after the light change as traffic started moving, the object separated into a single large sphere with the smaller spheres shooting off at absolutely incredible speeds, all in different trajectories.  a split second later the large sphere did the same thing. but it went in a straight line at the same height from left to right.  the others shot off in curving trajectories. they went out of sight in no more than a few seconds.  i was very very excited, but none of the other drivers seemed to be reacting at all. ( where is cb now?  25 years ago we all could have talked.)i did not doubt the experience.  there was no mention of anything in the press or media.  i can't believe i was the only one to have seen it.

i am now 63.  i ( and others in my family) have seen ufo's since the late 40's.  i have seen them in new mexico, california, michigan, maryland, and va.  no two experiences alike.  in my first experience i was 4 or 5 years old.  they went by very slowly just over the treetops. the adults around me all sat comfortably on the front porch and kept saying "they don't want to bother us."  this in silver spring, md.There were 3-4 of them not in a direct line or specific formation but definitely together. i believe now that this event coincided with the dates the white house was overflown. but i was just a small kid at the time.

a long time friend suggested i report tonight's sighting.  the suggection was that maybe i am not the only one to report it.

please do not pass on my e-mail address to anyone for any reason.  especially no pop-ups.  i am available on the cell number provided.  you may e-mail me direct, but please keep the address private.

thank you,
jennis strickland
content.summary: Blue/azure circle, no aura, no trail, looking south,straight ahead,straight falling trajectory, no change of speed, scheduled airline flights in vicinity ( dulles) very bright, really beautiful color

content.detailedDescription:
My name is rudi ardesch, i live in las vegas "sun city summerlin". my wife and i are sitting most afternoons and evenings outside on our patio. 
last week we witnessed two incidences in the sky that was not normal. i have been working, before my retirement, in aviation about all my life and i can surely identify a normal event from the extraordinary.
 
first event, we both notice a needlehead size light popping up next to a star, the star at about five o'clock, that's, if you look straight up in the sky with your anterior body facing north and about 15 degrees from your position. (east quadrant)
the light became real big, very bright and made the form of a pear, then disappeared, this all took place in just seconds, no sound of any kind.
it disappeared in the opposite direction with such a speed that the bright light when out of sight in less than two seconds. this sighting was on the 
12th of september at 7:30 pm. 
 
second event, two day's later on the 14th of september at about 6:15 pm, a white light appeared, the size of a bright star, coming from north moving south to the same star as mentioned above, moving at normal airplane speed, after about five seconds it disappeared, again no sound and no flashing navigation lights.
 
third event, this evening, september the 26th at about 7:15 we saw a bright flash in the same quadrant of the star mentioned above and five minutes later a second flash, also in the same position.
 
we belief that these objects were not normal, nor was it a case of optical illusion, we both saw the same things. we will keep our eyes open and let you know if we encounter more unusual objects, until then, you have our best wishes and regards,
rudi ardesch.
content.summary: This was not a close encounter but had enough evidence to consider it an ufo

content.detailedDescription: Here is a picture of a "light" object. it was 8:34am, the temp. was 74 and the humidity was 52. the sky was very clear and almost "no' breeze. i included the original, a slight blowup and 1 focus for clarity and a larger enhancement. i was in my front yard this morning 9/27/2006 when i saw the object in the sky and took the picture.
content.summary: Bright light in sky

content.detailedDescription: Tonight i went out at 8:50pm. i first saw 2 objests flying low,then a third one got just above the tree line and stopped and then slowly dropped to the earth. tonight these objects were all blinking silver and blue,very different from the others that i've seen.They all were coming from the east and heading west. this all took about 10 min. i have no idea where the one that went down or even landed but i am almost sure it landed southwest of my home in manchester ctr. vermont.I go out every night about the same time of the evening. but to see 5 and 1 go down was very odd.I am very comcernd about the one that dropped out of sight.These objects were all blinking a bright silver and bright blue color. almost star like but not i know the difference and there was no sound to be heard.
content.summary: Tonight i saw 5 objects but one of them stopped and then slowly dropped to the earth, the other 2 were high and the other 2 were low.

content.detailedDescription:
I was walking, saw movement in the sky and looked up, expecting to see a low cloud. but the object was not like the other clouds in the sky that night; it was opaque and it was moving much too quickly for a cloud, so i thought then it might be a flock of birds because there seemed to be small points of light on the underside of it that at first glance resembled white birds flying high in the sky. 

i then saw a very bright light moving towards the object--i thought it was an airplane and thought i'd monitor it to see if/how it reacted to the object. i looked back at the object (perhaps four seconds had elapsed since i first noticed it), decided it could not possibly be a flock of birds because 1) i have never seen a flock of birds flying at night in texas and 2) there was absolutely no fluctuation in the movement of the "lights" on the bottom of it. it looked most like a black chevron- or triangle-shaped object covered in a random pattern of dim stars, so that it blended in perfectly with the starfield except for the motion. it was moving quite rapidly across the sky.

as i watched the object, it simply disappeared. there was no more motion against the stars. i glanced back to see what the "airplane" was doing, and it too had vanished.

there was no sound at all with this event--i removed my walkman to listen. the next day my ears were ringing all day. looking back, i think it looked as if the milky way were sliding across the sky.
content.summary: Dark chevron shape with dim lights, silent, disappeared

content.detailedDescription:
I got a call from my sister whhile travelling from office to home (my sister was at that time 15 km aprox south west from me) she told me to look up at the sky that something shiny was moving towards my direction, i looked up from my car for some seconds and saw nothing in the zenith above me and told her that it was probably and iridium flare, i hug up and kept driving 2 minutes later when i reached a red traffic ligth and while waiting for it to turn green facing noth east i saw the object described by my sister moving in a sw --> ne direction and was amazed and exited because it was something i have never seen before (i'm an avid sky watcher and never miss meteor showers and i live less than 5 km from an airport with a military base, so i���m used to see planes of all shapes and colors).

the object had the size of a tylenol caplet at an arm lengt and it was at some 15 to 20 degrees above the horizon and at the speed it was moving i estimate that it would have crossed the sky in about 5 to 10 minutes (way too slow for an airplane).

about the shape and color i first belived it was something white and cigar shaped but then i noticed the sun shining on it an i realized it had a polished aluminum color and was disc shaped.

i observed the object for about 2 to 3 minutes before it went behind a cloud and never came back on the other side.

it migth be of wheigt to include that i have a 20 20 vision and that i whent ot a military high school and in my last year i received advanced observer training in an artillery batalion.
content.summary: Shining object slowly crossing daytime sky disapeared behind a cloud

content.detailedDescription:
Well i just read that report from michigan and his discription of the black beams sounds like the beams i photographed on the 23rd of september here in delray beach, florida.
i was not going to post them but since this report came in i mite as well put the pictures up.
i did not see these beams with my eyes they were just in the set of pictures i was taking of ufo's.
i reported them to my local mufon investgator and we could not come up with what they where.
i thought it may be a glitch in the camera and i had this camera for 5 years and have had no beams in any pictures.
the first picture was in the mid morning around 11:00am and the next two are around 5:50pm.
i have no idea what they are except i photographed that white disk video in that photo session. they may be related. anybody else see beams like these??
thanks jc
content.summary: Beams photographed on sept 23 in florida

content.detailedDescription:
Aurora ufo

fig 1
the northern lights seemed to be behind the trees, just beyond the edge of our property. a glowing, green, foggy mist, they were closer than usual, but not out of the ordinary. they had been in the exact same spot just a month earlier. as i walked across the driveway to the kennel, i looked up at them to see them go up higher, and move even closer, almost over the yard. i set the dogs free and turned around to go back inside.

fig 2
turning back toward the house, i looked up to notice that the glowing, green mist had struck out across the sky into two vibrant, green streaks, which is common, they extended all the way over the top of our property, and a little beyond.

they shimmered and moved up and down in a characteristic and familiar pattern for a few seconds and they were brighter than usual. they had a striking effect, making them appear very close. while i watched, the streak nearest to me, began to descend to the top of the driveway and condense into a luminous, shimmering, holographic "nebula".

fig 3
the nebula began to look smokey. quickly it changed into a gaseous cloud and as it advanced, i began to see vertical, neon- green tubes coming out from underneath, which seemed to be moving up and down. it proceeded down the path of the driveway from the right to the left. as it approached, it seemed to be a three-dimensional volume with a height and depth of approximately 20 x 20 ft. i did not have to look up to see it. eye-level to the lower portion of it, i was able to observe it in perspective as it slowly floated by.

it appeared to be a lively, swirling gaseous substance, illuminated by a cluster of several hundred long, neon- green, vertical, tubular rods, which projected out from underneath. they seemed to be floating in continuous parallel rows and were marching forward. i could see the tubular shaped rods repeated continuously throughout the underneath of the entire floating thing. though they appeared to be parallel, as they approached, i noticed a very slight angle of parallax. more of the rods became visible when it was directly in front of me. i looked straight into the depths of it where the individual, evenly spaced rods visually disappeared into a sea of luminous neon-green. the brilliant and intense color made the swirling, gaseous top glow with an ominous and eerie effect.  

like a gigantic amoeba, it "walked" across the sky using the tubular rods for legs. each tubular rod shape followed the one before it, in its own row, all at the same speed, as they floated up like pogo-sticks a few feet high, then back down to a constant level which was about eye-level to me. as floating, parallel, neon tubes, they bounced like golf-ball sized bouncy-balls moving above the written words to a song on a television screen. each tube seemed to be the resulting visual effect of one brilliant, green light that shone straight up like a laser beam, perpendicular to the ground, forming the optical illusion of a green rod or a fluorescent light bulb. the anomaly was like an amoebic creature or, according to what i now understand, a membrane "brain" of string theory. it was unlike anything i had ever seen before.   

after i finished the illustrations, i realized that i never really saw the entire thing from end to end, all at once. what i saw was the beginning of it as it approached, the middle as it was passing, and the end of it as it went up to the sky in a procession that took about one minute. the front and middle of it were trailing up to the sky on my left like green smoke, i noticed, when i turned my head to watch the last of it go past.

fig 4
after the entire floating mass had passed by, it returned to the sky in a trail of greenish smoke and formed into a streak overhead on my left. i was standing right between the two streaks, when the one i termed the "brain" spread out into a formation, similar to the wing span of a huge swan, with the former rods as individual feathers. the other of the two original streaks, was still in its original position, as if waiting. the "brain" moved in a little closer to it, as if to get it's attention, and it responded to the "brain" by moving in a little closer on my right. i was standing between them when a very beautiful thing happened. the "brain", using its wings as a human would use arms, beckoned the former to come forward, and then backed up, as if to gain momentum. like two huge swans in a heavenly, mythological ballet, they flew together in mirror image of each other.

fig 5
on contact of their "wing tips", a circle of lights was instantaneously created, composed of prismatic-colors that began to spin clockwise underneath a mass of swirling, white "smoke" or gas. as the whole ring spun around at a high speed, it descended to a height, which appeared to be only 30 ft. above me.

fig 6
when the circle of lights stopped spinning, the "smoke" began to settle into white beams of light, that shown upward, into the sky. the circle began to float up as well.

fig 7
the circle of lights ascended, and as it rose up, i could see individual lights "lifting off", aligning themselves with those of the same color.

fig 8
the lights rose straight up, high above me, so that i had to tilt my headway back to look up at it. it was vibrating and moving in a ���wiggly" way; not spinning. once it got to a certain height, of about 500 ft., it stopped and hovered, but it was never totally motionle.

shimmering vibrantly in prismatic colors, it hovered straight overhead in the shape of an ancient, symmetrical, arabesque design;  the same shape it might have held when the wing tips of the two "swans" first met in formation, if they had not started spinning. i could see the different colors of the lights aligned in repetitive rows, concentric to each other. the outside row contained violet lights. the next row in, was of violet- red. the third row in was red-orange and the fourth, innermost row was orange-yellow. i could see white beams of light pointing to the center, indicating that it was indeed an image with a focal point, and it was very high up and directly over my head.

fig 9
i stood in the middle of the driveway, where the enigma had existed as an amoebic cloud just minutes earlier, and i watched it for a while. i noticed that when it wiggled more vibrantly, the lights of like-color blended together into a "ribbon" effect that continued all the way around. sometimes there were sections of the individual lights and sections of the ribbons, causing a combined visual effect of the two. the rays of light all pointed to the center, indicating that it was directly over me.

fig 10
when i looked back up, it was spinning and descending once again to a level about 30-50 ft. above me. it seemed to me that the circle shape was a result of centrifugal force, of the downward propulsion.

fig11
without hesitation, the breaking point took the lead of the newly formed comet, and began to spiral inward, still clockwise, until it reached the center. the mist above it turned from a greenish color to an encompassing, rainbow haze. the comet condensed into an oval, white center. as it spiraled inward, the center seemed to become a little larger and rise up slightly.

fig12
i anticipated that the end of the comet's tail would reach the center, which it did, after what seemed to be about 15 seconds. once all the lights were condensed into the oval center, a hook shape projected out from the top of it which faced counterclockwise and held it's shape.

fig13
the hook shape bent back in counterclockwise direction and held its shape for about 5 seconds before the whole concentration exploded in the sky like a silent roman candle. exhibiting an array of colors in the same order as those observed within the arabesque ring, that had hovered over my head only minutes before, the explosion expanded across the sky immediately above me and spread out over our entire yard, with the familiar color sequence of violet on the outside; violet-red next, then red-orange, and finally orange-yellow, as the nearest to the center.

fig 14
as the lights fizzled to the ground, i could see that they had smokey, spiraling trails behind them, like an ordinary roman candle. the colorful lights began to diminish in order; beginning with the orange-yellow, and ending with the violet.

fig 15
when all the lights extinguished, smokey clouds hovered motionless, gradually fading to nothing.

-susan rodgers
content.distance: 20 Feet or Less, 21-100 Feet, 101-500 Feet, Unknown
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: An aurora, mist became two streaks. one desended, passed before me, then went back up. then ros

content.detailedDescription:
Today is september 27, 2006.

 

i was driving twards home at about 5:45 pm today.  i was about 10 miles from home on a 25 mile trip.  i always look to the sky occasionally to see if i see anything.  i have never seen anything in the sky.  i am ussually skeptical that i would ever see anything but, why not look.  i was driving pretty much north from kalamazoo.  i looked up at this clearing about 10 miles from home and i thought i saw something strange.  it looked like, what i would call, a black rainbow.  now, it hasn���t rained here in 2 days so, there should be no rainbow.  so, i thought it must be something on the windshield of my 1988 chevy 4wd.  i moved my head to the left and to the right.  nope, it was definitely in the sky somehow.  then i noticed, it was perfectly straight.  a perfectly straight black rainbow pointing exactly down to the ground where i was heading to.  that���s right, it was pointing at my house, 10 miles away.

 

now to describe this black rainbow.  it was following what appeared to be a jet stream.  but,  it was larger in width than the jet stream.  it was probably 8 times as wide as the jet stream, and it continued on farther than the jet stream, in fact it looked as if it went right to the ground, at my house.  but, again i was 10 miles away from my house so, who knows.  the thing was 8 times as wide as a jet stream, see through, and perfectly straight.  a jet stream would be the path of an airplane.  this was perfectly straight and wide.

 

unfortunately, i forgot to look at it when i got home, because my brakes needed repair, they were sticking, and i had the parts to fix it and went imediately to work.  i forgot to check for the thing when i got home.  bummer.

 

later that night my wifes daughter said she saw a ufo.  well, she has never said that.  so, i asked her to show me this ufo.  she took me outside and pointed out the end of our driveway at five or six stars.  these stars were low in the sky, and i have always said that a star low in the sky is messed up by the atmosphere at that level and stars can appear strange.  however, she has never said anything like that ever.  so, i observed these stars, the bottom one was bright and flickering.  not flashing like a plane but, flickering in a random pattern that probably was not atmospheric interference.  the other four or five stars she pointed to seemed to be moving, the bright one too, moving, around and around ever so slightly.  i will probably write them off as atmospheric disterbance but, then again this whole day did cause me to write you so, who knows.

 

one last thing i must report to you, is that, about 1 month ago, in barry county michigan, somewhere near m-37 there was a report on channel-8 news of crop damage.  ok, i thought here we go.  but, now i am not so sure.  the report was that some sorgum (spelling?) was knocked down in an unusual pattern.  swirling.  some ufo investigators were saying that it did not look like wind or hoax, it looked like radiation damage.  but, the ag department of michigan guy said it was caused by the farmer not harvesting his sorgum soon enough.  nobody seems to know.  and now the black rainbow.  and my wifes daughters sighting of moving stars.
content.summary: Black, perfectly straight rainbow like seethrough, skinny tube

content.detailedDescription: I've been seeing these things all summer but this was the first one in about 3 weeks. it was not moving very fast but was very brightin the  and changed color often. just like all the other ones i've seen all summer. it was in a roundish shape and then almost like a star at times.  there was no sound and it just moved like it was floating in the sky. i go out every night to look at the stars and to look for anything that's out there. i was on our back porch to watch it then moved outside on our patio to see how far it would go before it dissapeared. this took about 5 minutes,longer than usual.Then it just vanished into thin air!
content.summary: It came from the west to the east. blinking every second from silver to blue and then to red. then it just faded away. wasn't moving very fast.

content.detailedDescription:
My husband and i were traveling southeast on hwy 39 on a clear sunny day with no clouds.  somewhere between mosquero and logan i spotted what i thought was a weird looking small cloud through the front window.  then i realized there were no other clouds in the sky and it seemed to stand out so clearly. from that distance it looked almost like a vertical chevron.  my second reaction was that it was probably a weather balloon.  my husband didn't want to stop so i tried to view it through binoculars. very bumpy in the car so i couldn't really tell much about movement. it was not metallic looking, but looked as if it has pearlized surface. it did reflect the sun on the east side.  as we got closer to i 40 ( the vantage point where it looked the largest) the shape looked like a thin balloon or upside down teardrop. it never seemed to move.  when we reached i 40 and headed east to amarillo it appeared to be still south of us.  i kept looking back all the way to amarillo and could still see it in the southwest. it must have been very high.  i didn't think they still used the weather balloons very much any more due to environmental hazards and aviation traffic. when i first spotted it looked about 1/4" long and less than that in width. after logan, we were on hwy 469 to st. jon. amarillo is about 45 miles from st. jon (i think).  i would be interested to know if anyone else reported this or if there were weather balloons in the area.  it is probably something very explainable but it was so unusual that i felt the need to report it anyway.  i finally couldn't see it out of the back window anymore as we headed further east.
thank you
holly
content.summary: Clear sky, no clouds or jet trails.  spotted white upside down shaped teardrop that reflected the sun but looked more like a reflection on pearl.

content.detailedDescription:
I submitted this about a year ago with another site.   i saw somthing on your site that is very similar so i thought i should submit this with you.  see the event on your site dated aug. 2006.   also in ohio..

on a recent trip to southern ohio from cleveland, my daughter trinity, (26) and myself (50) were three quarters the way through a normally 4.5 hour trip. we turned off interstate 71 about 15 miles south of columbus on state rt. 62 at the harrisburg/ orient exit. we were seven miles south of i-71. the terrain is flat for the most part. upon approaching a rise in the road, (much like an overpass), the road curves to the left. 
as we were approaching the rise there was a bank of four white lights came on above the rise. they were straight ahead and beyond the rise/ curve maybe 500-1000 feet past. they were 300 ��� 400 feet high. they were street light sized and intensity and spaced 4-5, or more, feet apart in a stationary horizontal line. i know the height because i routinely climb a 200 foot tower for work. at first i thought they were maybe a cell phone tower. i did not see a strobe or beacon. my daughter was awake and saw the same thing. we didn���t say anything about it at the time. 

the time was approx. 2100 on friday the 28th of october. we were chatting normally for the next few miles maybe 5- 7 and the we saw exactly the same thing on the opposite side of the road. this time we both looked at each other in amazement. she asked what the heck was that and she indicated she had seen it back at the curve. i replied that it was probably an aircraft or cell phone tower. we kept talking about it and then we wondered if maybe we had seen a ufo. 

the lights did exactly the same thing each time. all four came on for about five seconds and then went out one at a time from left to right at one to two second intervals. each time it looked like we were passing the object because the viewed angle changed as we moved forward. speed was approx. 60 mph. the object stayed motionless. no sound. no shadows. no illumination of the surrounding structure. 

the night was very clear. moon was maybe a crescent. air was cool, about 35 deg f. we were well into the country. not much ambient light. 

we continued talking about it the rest of the trip. we arrived at out destination at the expected time, about an hour later. we had not been on this route since may but had been this way many times before. we decided not to worry about it but to look closely on the return trip, which was two days later. it would be daylight on the return trip. thirty-six hours later we were on our way back home. we had decided to watch closely once we were north of washington courthouse. we would then know if there were indeed cell phone towers in the area. there were no cell phone towers anywhere in the vicinity of rt. 62 north of washington courthouse and all the way past the overpass where we first noticed the lights.

would be interested if anything like this has ever been reported.  would like the chance to discuss this as i now have some theories about the possibilities.
content.summary: Row of 4 lights blinked off one at a time from left to right

content.detailedDescription:
I rose for work this morning at 6am, as usual. at about 6:30am, i went out my back (kitchen) door and down the steps off my deck, with two of my dogs so they could potty. i don't remember a visible moon, and only my back porch light was on, as well as a street light in front of my house.

it was cool out (my breath was visible), so i looked up expecting a clear sky, which was the case. i live in a remote area, which makes for good stargazing. also, while it was still dark out, it was beginning to get light in the east.

at this time, i saw what i thought was a bright star or planet, in the western sky near celestial north. after a couple of seconds, i realized it was moving.

i maintained my gaze on the object, with the naked eye, as it moved slowly north or northeast (it's hard to tell precisely, as my road does not run true north-south), and lost it in the treeline 1-2 minutes later.

(i should note we get very little air traffic over my house, except for small, low-flying private planes and the occasional life flight helicopter. we do live about 25 miles north of grissom reserve air base.)

at first, i dismissed it as a plane. then i realized there were no flashing or colored lights as on a plane or helicopter. also, i saw nothing resembling a comet tail or contrail. it was impossible to judge mass or distance of the object.

the path of motion seemed to be ballistic, and i saw no accel/decel, stopping, or turning of the object. the was no perceptible helicopter or plane/jet sound, though i do have a small dam on my property which provides background noise.

i've seen shooting stars before, and this was not one of them. i doubted i'd be able to see a satellite or the iss under these conditions, with the naked eye.

after a few minutes, i returned inside and resumed my morning routine, mentioning the sighting to my wife who, while not as intrigued by these things as i, has an open mind, and said something like, "hmm, that's interesting."

i am a healthy, middle-aged white male with no criminal history, or history of mental illness or illegal drug use. while credulous, i also like to think of myself as an intellectual with good critical thining skills. i am a cad engineer by trade.

i hope this report is of some use to you. feel free to contact me with any further questions.
content.summary: A star- or planet-like point of light in the predawn sky, moving slowly from high western sky approximately northward

content.detailedDescription: I was looking about the sky about 3am for something brighter than normal to look at through my new telescope.  a bright object appearing as the brightest star in southwesterly sky approximately 10 degrees above th horizontal at about 3am traveled 60 to 75 degrees to the right (seemingly in a northerly dirction in about 5 hours).  continuing its travel direction while i was watching this well into daylight, it was on an upward linear slope until at about 8am it was about 45 to 50 degrees above th horizontal, and possibly due west of my location, on a hill outside marietta at my home in pennsylvania.  when focused in my 9mm lens in my meade 70 some mm diameter telescope it took one minute and 50 seconds to cross the entire field of scopes view.  wonder if this must be some planet?  when focused in it seemed to change brilliance. when de-focused slightly it had th appearance of being a circle full of blue lights (dots).  when de-focused in the opposite directionit gave the appearance of being 3 or more white concentric circles with the outerband being a yellowish color. i lost sight of it when i went to house for necessity and could not locate at all with anything i tried--my view finder was useless in daylght and naked eye showed nothing after sun came up and panning with 9mm lens was no good either.  it was not nearly as bright after the sun came up.  befor daylight however with my electroniic (black & white) eypiece fro meade it appeared flatened like a disc or oval on tv screen and on a 45 degree angle coninuouly, in its course as previoully described.  i have looked at another brightr oobject since this episode and defocusing in one direction gave me the same blue dots as before--but defocusing in the ot5her direction showed a circular object made up of horizontal yellowish lines with space in between them.
content.summary: Bright looking object in sky moved across the field of my telescope on seemingly northerly heading from a southwesterly position.
Was tracking a satellite and saw it zig zag across the sky

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were having dinner and decided to open the blinds and saw the first object coming from the west. the first object was cigar shaped and was moving as an aircraft would.  it looked like the sun was reflecting off it, but the sun was setting in the west (behind the object) and through the binoculars the entire object was glowing.  we thought it was a plane, but then it started moving north across the sky and then turned and started going west again.  we then noticed a second object that appeared to be coming from the west towards us.  we knew the object was coming towards us because it got bigger.  the second object turned north and continued to move north.  as it moved, it appeared to take on a cloud like appearance.  the first object was almost out or site as it had moved further west and then it disappeared below the hills that are directly west of our house.  while the second object continued to move north, a third object appeared about the same place as the first two.  this object was shaped in the classic bell curve.  it appeared to rise above the skyline from below, but it could have been flying low and just come over the hill while it was ascending.  at any rate, it ascended vertically and then appeared to bank with the bottom of the bell angled towards our position about 45 degrees off vertical and horizontal with the top of the bell still visible.  the second cigar shaped object was still moving north.  the bell shaped object then turned over about 180 degrees so that the top of the bell was pointed downward the same as the bottom of the bell had been.  that is why i said it appeared to flip over 180 degrees.  then, while my wife was watching it through the binoculars, it just ���blinked��� out of existence and was gone from view.  there was no moving in any direction so that it could be assumed that it just went out of site; it just disappeared from view.  the second cigar shaped object was still moving north and as i watched it through the binoculars, it slowly faded from view and just disappeared also.  again, it was not moving in any changed direction or at any increased speed, so that it could be assumed to have disappeared over the horizon, (the first object did that); it just disappeared as the bell object had.  

there was no way to estimate how big the objects were, how far away they were or at what speed they were traveling.  because i have seen jets moving in all directions, in this location and others (as the phoenix airport is in that direction), the objects were not traveling at any high rate of speed, not faster than jets and much slower, especially the bell shaped object.  i would estimate by an educated guess that the objects were somewhere over the phoenix area.  even through the binoculars, the objects were glowing brightly such as a cloud might with the sun below and behind it.  they did not behave like any cloud i have ever seen and were not clouds.
content.summary: 3 objects appear and move accross sky - two fade and then blink out

content.detailedDescription: I have been watching this and 2 other identicle objects for over 18 months.  i thought they were stars at first but i noticed the red pulsing and started watching them closer. i was hard to reference them against the dark sky but after months of watching i began to see small rapid movements as if they were adjusting their position. when the third one appeared several months ago it took a position close enough to the side of the house that i had an immovable reference to watch it from.  i can't tell you how high it is but it is higher than the cirro cumulus clouds that pass under it.  i live under several southbound victor airways (from philadelphia)and i've never seen a passenger jet come close.  i have estimated it's motion as mostly straight lines, mostly jostling around as if it is unable to keep a smooth station keeping.  the longest straight line motion was equal to the width of half a moon when it's at zenith.  i have seen it accelerate to remarkable speeds almost insantaneously; about 2 to 3 times that of a passenger jet 50 miles out from the airport. i am refering to relative motion as i observed from the ground.The passenger jets are at least 15,000 feet and if this object is above 60,000 feet as i have observed in the past, then it is clearly traveling in excess of 1000 mph, over sudden short distances and making abrupt right angle turns and 180 degree turns to sudden stops. if there were people in that object, they would be the consistancy of peanut butter by now.  i don't have any evidence that this object is extra terrestrial.  i did nor see it leave for space.  on the contrary it rises over the horizon as if it were a star, so i would have to say it is terrestrial in that sense.  i have had a long life interest in aviation. i soloed in 1968 and have had the odd occasion to fly many times since then but am not licensed.  i do have a strong interest in and can identify many airplanes, even rare ones on sight.  i qualified to operate nuclear power plants in the navy and had a top secret security clearance.  i was never exposed to anything that can perform like this object.  i can promise you anything, but if you show up you might see it too.  i am somewhat sceptical and was willing to listen to "reason" until 2 nights ago i was watching the one to the north east when to my surprice a meteor fell very close to it and the dam thing moved out of the way.  i watched it very close for the remainder of the evening and decided to report it. i don't know what it is and if anyone comes out here and tells me that they do know what it is, they will need to do some serious explaining because without a telescopic camera we just won't be able to get a grip on this.  as i am writing this, the south western object is in view and descending slowly as is the western object. it is descending in increments as if to stay in link with the rest of the sky. the northeast and most active object has not appeared yet.  it is 8:22pm est.  i have an unobstructed view of 180 degrees of the compass from ssw to nne and straight up. the view towards newark, de is washed by the lights but my house blocks the light.  i have seen at least 2 other very interesting objects of a different nature but can't give anything but an interesting story about them.  this case is different because my wife has seen the object move.  she is a paramedic and was also a 911 operator.  i have many years of experience as a machinist and understand many of the illusions that can can obstruct visual observations.  by experience i correct for many but i can understand why visual observations are suspect.  that is why i waited until i was sure in my own mind that this object should be investigated. it is 8:49pm est and the southwest object just went below the horizon.  the western object is one third as high as the north star.  the northeast object has not appeared yet and i don't expect it until after 9pm est.  it's 9:07pm est and i have spotted the ne object through the trees.  i am standing on an 8ft deck so from ground level it may have come over the true horizon within the last 15 minutes or so.  the erratic motion is quite apparent now with the trees for reference and there is no wind. i now have two more witnesses.  it is 9:30pm. on other nights it gets higher in the sky until i give up and go to bed.  the western object is setting on the horizon and is showing some erratic movement and the neastern object is clearing the tree line at 9:49pm.  i don't have a clue what they are but we all agree they are not stars. it sparkles like a diamond. it's 10:00pm and the northeastern object is above the trees and exhibiting behavior absolutely unlike any aircraft i know of.  i'm going to bed and ill see these guys again tomorrow night. so stop by around 9:30 or 10:00 and see the show. goodnight.
content.summary: A star like object in the same place every night for months has a blue white color with nearly imperceptable red pulse suddenly moves out of the path of a meteor.  i have seen it make small sudden movements since then.

content.detailedDescription: I was on a day trip to lands end in cornwall uk i was taking photos of the scenery the picture i am sending you i didnt see the ufo in the photo it was only when i put them on the pc that there is 2 orbs in the background i dont know what they are but they wasnt there when i took the photos sorry thats all the info i have
content.summary: Suprise ufo

content.detailedDescription:
A clear and sunny day in a small city in the country. important to say there was a small airport w/ small planes.No big planes flying over the place (it wasn't a route) and jet planes weren't flying in brazil by that time. i went out the house, located on a high place) and something in the sky captured my attention: a shine. when i looked at the sky there was that big "cigar" flying very very fast and the sundown light was causing the shine in one of its "tips". it had no wings or other visible details. it appeared to be in metal, plumb color but "polished". totally soundless. 
based on my experience with planes, i can estimate it was about 3,000 meters high (1,800 feet)and the speed was 4/5 times more than a jet plane (3,000 to 4,000 km/hour) or more. it came from east crossing the sky and disappeared going to the west. at the distance i saw it, i can say it's size was very similar to a boing 707. 
it was such a surprise to see that and it was so fast, i don't remember thinking something special. only when it desappeared i went in the house and told to the family what i saw. i was 17 years old and of course the fact had impact on me, but positive. since that time i use to read about.
content.summary: It crossed the sky from east to west, about  3,000 feet high

content.detailedDescription:
I'm seeing objects here now on a daily basis but don't want to flood mufon with pictures and video so i'll just post once in awhile to give others a chance to post their stuff.
i see allot of really good pictures and video coming in from various websites and its amazing!

here's another video clip of some footage i shot on sept 23rd 2006.
i had just setup the camera and three minutes into the video a white oval disk showed up and flew north from my location.
as you can see the sky was hazy but i think it's good enough to post.
i also photographed when this disk was high up in the clouds.

this is the same area i have filmed all those objects and have seen many objects in this same area for the past six months.
it's just a matter of time before i get a really good close-up.
the two pictures included are
the first is of the white disk and the second are two black objects.

looks like the activity is also picking up here at night again.
i saw the flashing strobe lights again and an object streak straight down from above at 9:20pm towards the boca raton area or maybe even south of that towards ft lauderdale. it was not bright this time rather a fireball color and the way to describe it as if you threw a lit match stick.
that���s it from here.
jc
content.summary: Objects sighted on a daily basis in florida

content.detailedDescription: We were just leaving a resturant at the mall of  lp 1604 north when we got to the exit and my mom said whatis that in the distance. i looked up it look like it was somewhere between valero and utsa. it was silver metallic object and at first we thought it was a big balloon like a small good year blinp but really shiny in the sky but then all at once it looked like it was morphing or turning. it also looked like it had a roundish body and tail. my mom at first thought it was a helicopter but when it started to change and morph (this is the only way i can think to explain how it looked) she said she thought it looked like it was in 3-d and then started to look kind of flat and not in 3-d. it was very strange and not an airplane. so we pulled out onto the access road and looked at it for another minute. we decide to take the turn around and get a better look to see what it really was but after we went on the turn around  1604 south it was gone. so went back up the lp 1604 north back home we looked up in the sky and saw a black dot way up high and it could have been a bird except it was moving pretty darn fast. we turned in at hills and dales to look again and it was gone too and it had been heading toward the where the silver object was. my mon and i have never seen anything like those objects and i have never reported anything like this before. i really have to say we did not know what either of those objects were.
content.summary: Pulling out of the mall exit off  lp 1604  north and all of a sudden my mom said what is that!

content.detailedDescription: My son and i were driving back from the outer banks of north carolina after having spent the labor day weekend there.  we were on highway 158 about 35 miles north of kill devil hills.  there were a lot of large thunder clouds in the area but it did not rain until later in the day.  i was looking up the road at some of the clouds and saw an oval shaped glowing object, slightly larger than a commercial jet, traveling from east to west at about 5,000 feet.  i would estimate it was about four to five miles ahead of us straight up the road.  i had sight of it for about three seconds as it went past the front of the cloud ahead of us and disappeared into another.  i saw it long enough to realize it was moving at a high rate of speed based upon the distance it covered before it disappeared and it was not any type of conventional craft i was familiar with.  this was the first ufo i had seen in about six years and i was kind of excited.  i would guess this was a disk and the the glow around it made it look more of an oval shape from the distance i was from it.  it did not have sharp defined edges, almost hazy looking. i kept looking at the cloud it had gone into hoping to see it come out the other side, but there were a lot of trees along the road and a lot of traffic around me as people were going home from the beach after the holiday.  by the time i saw someplace to pull over the thing would have been long gone so i kept on my way home.  i am a member of nc mufon.
content.summary: I saw a glowing disk/oval shaped object moving in front of a cloud.

content.detailedDescription: A few neighbors including my wife and i,and once in a while a friend would stop by,would sit outside in our courtyard of the apartments where we lived in oak park.Mind you,no drugs or alchol was involved.We would sit out at night and just converse.Sorry about date and time but you can see this happened a long time ago.However i am sure of what i,and my friend saw that night.The few other people that were out that night were to busy talking.We just so happen to be looking up when a light appeared that was about as bright as the brightest star.It wasn't blinking and it was about the same color as a star. it was going from the s.W.Going in a n.E.Direction.At first we thought it was a comet, but then it made a right turn whent a short distance,made another right turn went a short distance and it made another right turn and continued on the same plane as when we first sighted it.Anotherwords it made three right turns in a square formation.It never slowed down and after it made the last turn it streeked off and we no longer could see it.A short time later,i'm guessing no more than half an hour, we saw what looked like the same light streeking back from the direction we lost sight of it going back to the direction when we first sighted it. this time it didn't make any turns it was just faster than all hell.
content.summary: Saw a light streeking across the night sky and made 3 right turns without slowing or stoping
